EPUB3 Multimedia Features
A Lighting Overview

Adam Obeng
27th July 2011

EPUB: In theory

  • International Digital Publishing Forum

  • Free and open
  • Re-flowable (word wrap) and re-sizable text
  • Inline raster and vector images
  • Embedded metadata
  • DRM support
  • CSS styling
  • Support for alternative renditions in the same file
  • Use of out-of-line and inline XML islands to extend the functionality of EPUB


    • (Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EPUB)

EPUB: In practice

  • META-INF/container.xml
  • OEBPS/content.opf
  • *.html
  • Other web-like stuff

Fixed layout: not actually an EPUB3 feature

  • com.apple.ibooks.display-options.xml
  • CSS: 
    	body {
width: 1200px;
height: 1700px;
	}
  • XHTML: 
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=1200, height=1700"/>
  • Other stuff

Images

  • Pretty basic HTML 
    <img src="image.jpg" alt="Alternate text"/ >
  • CSS to make images full-page (or not)

Video

    Almost as basic HTML(5) 
    					<video src="video.mp4" width="480" height="320"
					 controls="controls"/ >
  • Scripted control is possible (but to be avoided)
  • Other HTML5/CSS3 features?

Media Overlay

  • SMIL file synchronises audio and video 
    					<par id="audio-0">
						<text src="page1.html#l_1_1"/> 
						<audio src="beowulf.wav" clipBegin="3s" clipEnd="10s"/>
					</par>
  • A couple of other declartions in manifest
  • Optional CSS
  • Generation is tedious

Javascript

  • In theory, anything that can be done on a web page
  • In practice, it's still a book
